model.map

Class Country

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.map.Country

  • public class Country
extends java.util.Observable
    This class is handling the information and the behavior of countries. It holds data about the army in the country and also the relationships with the country's neighbors
    Author:
    Yann Kerichard, Yueshuai Jiang, Che-Shao Chen

      • canSendTroopsToAlly

        public boolean canSendTroopsToAlly()
        To ensure a country can send troops during the fortification phase. The country must have more than 1 army and must have allied neighbors.
        Returns:
        a boolean saying if the fortification move is possible.

      • isConnectedTo

        public boolean isConnectedTo(Country destination)
        This functions looks for a connected path of allied countries between 2 countries (this and destination)
        Parameters:
        destination - is the country to reach
        Returns:
        if a path has been found between both countries

      • canAttack

        public boolean canAttack()
        Check if a country can attack an other country. Country's armies number must be greater than 1, and there should be at least one enemy country in the neighborhood.
        Returns:
        If the country can attack

      • getEnnemyNeighbor

        public Country getEnnemyNeighbor()
        method to get neighbors that is enemy
        Returns:
        return to neighbor list type

        function that check the country can attack by who
        Parameters:
        attackerCtry - the attacker's country
        Returns:
        true id the country can be attack otherwise false
